description.narrative: Capacity Kenya works closely with the Government of Kenya and health sector leaders to strengthen and transform health workforce systems in the public, private, and faith-based sectors to enhance health service delivery. The project aims to strengthen health workforce policy and planning, build the knowledge and skills of health workers, and improve health worker productivity and retention.

Selected activities include: developing and supporting a rapid hire program (RHP); convening the first National Human Resources for Health (HRH) Conference; improving multi-stakeholder collaboration in HRH; and installing and supporting the iHRIS open source software developed by IntraHealth that helps health sector managers assess staffing problems and design and evaluate effective solutions. IntraHealth has also addressed the knowledge and skills needed by health workers by conducting a national performance needs assessment of the health training system and launching a Center for Excellence in Family Planning at the Kenya Medical Training College (KMTC). To improve productivity and retention of health workers, the project has created a new performance appraisal system, including a toolkit that allows national and local health facility managers to better evaluate themselves and the workers they supervise. In addition, the project has collaborated with the Ministry for the Development of Northern Kenya and Other Arid Lands to recruit more students into the health care field; provided scholarships to encourage recipients to staff health facilities in underserved areas; and offered distance learning and professional development opportunities to health workers.
